snippet: Uruguayan lawmakers voted Wednesday to legalize same-sex marriage, making the South American country the third in the Americas to do so, after Canada and Argentina.
abstract: Uruguayan lawmakers vote to legalize same-sex marriage, making South American country third in Americas to do so, after Canada and Argentina.
lead_paragraph: Uruguayan lawmakers voted Wednesday to legalize same-sex marriage, making the South American country the third in the Americas to do so, after Canada and Argentina.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
